reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn on Tomales Bay is a nice place for a romantic, quiet getaway from the world. Yes, it is not the typical "inn" - but my husband and I found it nice to have so much privacy. The room was large with an amazingly beautiful view of Tomales Bay. If you enjoy peace and beauty - this is what you get here. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the small fireplace added a nice touch. Having breakfast in the room was great - and the food was very good as well. Enjoyed the extra touches too- backpack (thanks! that helped for all the hiking!), games and books in the room.
reviews.title: Perfect View - Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is not bad. The good. It is spotless and the bedding is comfortable, breakfast service in your room.The view is nice. The inconvenient. It is far from Point Reyes, so we drove around a lot. . There wasn't really a place to walk or sit outside. The cooking needs improvement. Oh and be warned, there is no cell service.
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely inn tucked away off the main road and so lovely and quiet. Nicely furnished room and breakfasts great - nothing too much trouble for the innkeepers, Bob and Lynnette. A great location for exploring Point Reyes and beyond. Loads of great walks and not too far from San Francisco either - the best of both worlds. Anyone who does not rate this place must be mad. Rooms are very clean and nicely furnished and guest towels white and fluffy putting most hotels to shame. Try this place and you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: A hidden gem off Highway 1
Serious Problems With Inn on Tomales Bay
reviews.text: Inn keeper is friendly, but this really isn't an "inn" - they're just renting rooms. The living area, which has been used recently by smokers, is locked when the innkeepers are away. Quite minimalist in all respects - room, amenities, linens, breakfast. Truly an inn "of last resort". At $400 for two nights, we felt we had way overpaid. Yes, the view of the bay is very nice.
